name: Closure phase - BT Report
description:
| Phase | Step | Outcome |
| ------------- |:-------------:| -----:|
| Closure Blue Team  | 1 of 3 | Creation of the Blue Team Report |

# Tasks

- `Task #1 - Inform key people`
- `Task #2 - Map red team's attacks with blue team detection`
- `Task #3 - Identify detection gaps`

# Blue Team Report

after the execution of the test by the red team, the blue team have to map all the steps with detections. The objective of this report is to identify those information gaps where the team needs to improve.

The final  phase is the execution of the test developed previously in the `Entity` environment. At this point, the red team will try to get all the flags that the threat intelligence team proposed in its report. The ultimate goal is to get into the systems to be able to show that there are risks to be able to work on them later.

# Outcome

The final report should have the following information:

* Successful detections
* Detections gaps
* Visibility gaps

tasks.title: Task #1 - Inform key people
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task hasn't dependencies.

# Goal

Inform key people in the blue team about the tests performed by the red team. Some of these key people may be the following.

- SOC Manager
- DFIR Manager
- Threat Detection Manager

tasks.title: Task #3 - Identify detection gaps
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on the `Task #2 - Map red team's attacks with blue team detection` of this case.

# Goal

Now that you have the mapping of all the steps of the red team with the detections that you were able to identify, it is time to focus on those steps that were not detected.

To do this, it is recommended to make a table like the following to help you understand possible ways of detection.


| RT step | Blue Team detection | Data Sources |
| ------------- |-------------|-------------|
| vbs script connected with C2   | no | "Network Traffic: Network Traffic Content", "Network Traffic: Network Traffic Flow" |
| Process injection using Thread Execution Hijacking  | no |                 "Process: OS API Execution", "Process: Process Modification", "Process: Process Access" |

As you can see, we've added the Data Source column with values. This information is obtained by MITRE, which can help us know where to look for such behavior.

tasks.title: Task #2 - Map red team's attacks with blue team detection
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on Red Team Report with all the steps.

# Goal

**As a red teamer**, your goal is to help the blue team and explain in as much detail as possible the steps taken during the testing phase. Think that this collaboration with the blue team will be key to improve the security posture and minimize risks in the `Entity`.

**As a blue teamer**, your objective is to relate each step taken by the red teamer to possible detections in your technology that evidence the step taken by the red teamer. Once these steps are evidenced, the following is recommended:

- If the step was detected but no alert originated, it is recommended to set up some kind of alert for the next time such a step occurs.

Generating a table on each step taken by the network team with the related detection will help to have a quick overview of the gaps (note that the following values in the table are just examples).


| RT step | Blue Team detection| 
| ------------- |-------------|
| Execution of `wscript.exe` to load a malicious vbs script | wscript_vbs_rule | 
| vbs script connected with C2   | no |
